001package io.jstach.rainbowgum.output;
002
003import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties;
004import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.Property;
005
006/**
007 * Builder to create {@link io.jstach.rainbowgum.output.FileOutput }.
008 * Creates file output.
009 * <table class="table">
010 * <caption><strong>Properties retrieved from LogProperties</strong></caption>
011 * <tr>
012 * <th>Property Pattern</th>
013 * <th>Type</th>
014 * <th>Required</th>
015 * <th>Default</th>
016 * <th>Description</th>
017 * </tr>
018 * <tr>
019 * <td><code>{@value PROPERTY_uri }</code></td>
020 * <td><code>URI</code></td>
021 * <td><code>true</code></td>
022 * <td><code>null</code></td>
023 * <td>File uri.</td>
024 * </tr>
025 * <tr>
026 * <td><code>{@value PROPERTY_fileName }</code></td>
027 * <td><code>String</code></td>
028 * <td><code>true</code></td>
029 * <td><code>null</code></td>
030 * <td>File name.</td>
031 * </tr>
032 * <tr>
033 * <td><code>{@value PROPERTY_append }</code></td>
034 * <td><code>Boolean</code></td>
035 * <td><code>false</code></td>
036 * <td><code>null</code></td>
037 * <td>Whether or not to append to existing file.</td>
038 * </tr>
039 * <tr>
040 * <td><code>{@value PROPERTY_prudent }</code></td>
041 * <td><code>Boolean</code></td>
042 * <td><code>false</code></td>
043 * <td><code>null</code></td>
044 * <td>Logback prudent mode where files are locked on each write.</td>
045 * </tr>
046 * </table>
047 */
048public final class FileOutputBuilder {
049
050        /**
051         * The properties to be retrieved from config will have
052         * this prefix.
053         */
054        static final String PROPERTY_PREFIX = "logging.output.{name}.";
055        
056        /**
057         * <code>{@value #PROPERTY_uri } = java.net.URI</code> File uri.
058         */
059        static final String PROPERTY_uri = PROPERTY_PREFIX + "uri";
060        /**
061         * <code>{@value #PROPERTY_fileName } = java.lang.String</code> File name.
062         */
063        static final String PROPERTY_fileName = PROPERTY_PREFIX + "fileName";
064        /**
065         * <code>{@value #PROPERTY_append } = java.lang.Boolean</code> Whether or not to append to existing file.
066         */
067        static final String PROPERTY_append = PROPERTY_PREFIX + "append";
068        /**
069         * <code>{@value #PROPERTY_prudent } = java.lang.Boolean</code> Logback prudent mode where files are locked on each write.
070         */
071        static final String PROPERTY_prudent = PROPERTY_PREFIX + "prudent";
072        
073        private final String propertyPrefix;
074        final Property<java.net.URI> property_uri;
075        final Property<java.lang.String> property_fileName;
076        final Property<java.lang.@org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable Boolean> property_append;
077        final Property<java.lang.@org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable Boolean> property_prudent;
078        
079        private final java.lang.String name;
080        private java.net.URI uri = null;
081        private java.lang.String fileName = null;
082        private java.lang.@org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable Boolean append = null;
083        private java.lang.@org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable Boolean prudent = null;
084        
085        /**
086         * Create a builder for {@code io.jstach.rainbowgum.output.FileOutput }.
087         * @param name will fill <code>{name}</code> in <code>logging.output.{name}.</code>. Name of output not file name.
088         */
089        public FileOutputBuilder(
090                        java.lang.String name
091                        ) {
092                java.util.Map<String,String> prefixParameters = java.util.Map.of(
093                                "name", name
094                        );
095                this.propertyPrefix = LogProperties.interpolateKey(PROPERTY_PREFIX, prefixParameters);
096                this.name = name;
097                property_uri = Property.builder()
098                        .toURI()
099                        .build(LogProperties.interpolateKey(PROPERTY_uri, prefixParameters));
100
101                property_fileName = Property.builder()
102                                                .build(LogProperties.interpolateKey(PROPERTY_fileName, prefixParameters));
103
104                property_append = Property.builder()
105                        .toBoolean()
106                        .build(LogProperties.interpolateKey(PROPERTY_append, prefixParameters));
107
108                property_prudent = Property.builder()
109                        .toBoolean()
110                        .build(LogProperties.interpolateKey(PROPERTY_prudent, prefixParameters));
111
112        }
113
114        
115        /**
116         * Sets <strong>required</strong> uri.
117         * File uri.
118         * Default is <code>null</code>.
119         * @param uri <code>{@value #PROPERTY_uri } = java.net.URI</code> File uri.
120         * @return this builder.
121         */
122        public FileOutputBuilder uri(java.net.URI uri) {
123                this.uri = uri;
124                return this;
125        }
126        
127        /**
128         * Sets <strong>required</strong> fileName.
129         * File name.
130         * Default is <code>null</code>.
131         * @param fileName <code>{@value #PROPERTY_fileName } = java.lang.String</code> File name.
132         * @return this builder.
133         */
134        public FileOutputBuilder fileName(java.lang.String fileName) {
135                this.fileName = fileName;
136                return this;
137        }
138        
139        /**
140         * Sets append.
141         * Whether or not to append to existing file.
142         * Default is <code>null</code>.
143         * @param append <code>{@value #PROPERTY_append } = java.lang.Boolean</code> Whether or not to append to existing file.
144         * @return this builder.
145         */
146        public FileOutputBuilder append(java.lang.@org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable Boolean append) {
147                this.append = append;
148                return this;
149        }
150        
151        /**
152         * Sets prudent.
153         * Logback prudent mode where files are locked on each write.
154         * Default is <code>null</code>.
155         * @param prudent <code>{@value #PROPERTY_prudent } = java.lang.Boolean</code> Logback prudent mode where files are locked on each write.
156         * @return this builder.
157         */
158        public FileOutputBuilder prudent(java.lang.@org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable Boolean prudent) {
159                this.prudent = prudent;
160                return this;
161        }
162        
163        /**
164         * Creates {@code io.jstach.rainbowgum.output.FileOutput } from this builder.
165         * @return {@code io.jstach.rainbowgum.output.FileOutput }.
166         * @throws java.io.FileNotFoundException if factory method fails.
167         */
168        public io.jstach.rainbowgum.output.FileOutput build()  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException{
169                return io.jstach.rainbowgum.output.FileOutput.of(
170                                this.name
171                                , this.uri
172                                , this.fileName
173                                , this.append
174                                , this.prudent
175                                );
176        }
177        
178        /**
179         * Fills the builder from properties.
180         * @param properties not null.
181         * @return this updated builder.
182         */
183        public FileOutputBuilder fromProperties(LogProperties properties) {
184                this.uri = property_uri.get(properties).value(this.uri);
185                this.fileName = property_fileName.get(properties).value(this.fileName);
186                this.append = property_append.get(properties).valueOrNull(this.append);
187                this.prudent = property_prudent.get(properties).valueOrNull(this.prudent);
188                return this;
189        }
190        
191        /**
192         * Turns the builder into java.util.Properties like Map skipping values that are null.
193         * @param consumer apply is called where first arg is key and second is value.
194         */
195        public void toProperties(java.util.function.BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
196                if (this.uri != null) {
197                        consumer.accept(property_uri.key(), property_uri.propertyString(this.uri));
198                }
199                if (this.fileName != null) {
200                        consumer.accept(property_fileName.key(), property_fileName.propertyString(this.fileName));
201                }
202                if (this.append != null) {
203                        consumer.accept(property_append.key(), property_append.propertyString(this.append));
204                }
205                if (this.prudent != null) {
206                        consumer.accept(property_prudent.key(), property_prudent.propertyString(this.prudent));
207                }
208        }
209        
210        /**
211         * The interpolated property prefix: {@value #PROPERTY_PREFIX}.
212         * @return resolved prefix which should end with a "<code>.</code>".
213         */
214        public String propertyPrefix() {
215                return this.propertyPrefix;
216        }
217        
218}
